loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 42 years old and living a simple life with her family in the peaceful village of San Juan, Isabela. Her husband Mayo is a "tricycle" driver. The couple keeps on praying to have a child, and they are very optimistic that God has a purpose and exact plans for them.

Gemma maintains a typical store in their village. At present, she is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 that she will use to buy more groceries for her sari-sari (community-based store) business. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and hopefully God will keep on pouring more blessings on them. She has promised to take good care of her business that she started, for she believes that it was a blessing from God that she must treasure.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is married with 7 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Genara is 48 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Genara has a firewood sales business in the Philippines. Genara requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell.

Genara has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Genara would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Los Arbolitos Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los Arbolitos” está conformado por 6 mujeres  y un hombre el grupo está ubicado en la comunidad de Tres Estrellas es una comunidad muy alejada del municipio es un lugar donde el transporte está muy escaso y por lo general la gente se dedica a la agricultura,  el nombre del grupo lo eligieron ya que un integrante del grupo donde se reunían habia sembrado unos arbolitos pequeños y así fue como le pusieron al grupo. Esta vez los integrantes han solicitado el crédito para invertir en sus actividades como por ejemplo: doña Ángela invertirá en bordados, María Leonely, Placida e Ignacia comprara borregos, Maximino  invertirá en tienda de abarrotes,  y doña Magdalena invertirá en perfumes, todos están muy agradecidos por el crédito otorgado ya que podrán compra todo lo que les haga falta, Doña Maura quien es la representante del grupo nos cuenta que tiene 47 años de edad está casada desde hace 29 años con el señor Federico, quien trabaja en la obra juntos aun tiene dos niños que dependen de ellos quienes estudian uno en la primaria y otro en la secundaria, doña Maura se dedica  a la elaboración de bordados como servilletas, manteles, bordados para santitos, decoraciones para mesas y otros muebles,  “Desde niña aprendí ya que mi mamá me enseño a bordar pero también me gusto mucho ya que terminados se veían muy bonitos", esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para comprar hilos de distintos colores, tela cuadrille y agujas, la dificultad más grande que presenta doña Maura es la venta de sus bordados ya que casi en toda la comunidad las señoras hacen sus bordados y no ya no compran como antes pero esta no la detiene para seguir hacen ya que también los exhibe en las mesas de una fiesta como esta vez que la visitamos estaba muy contenta ya que su hijo se casaba, una de las metas de doña Maura es comprar borregos, y mejorar su vivienda cuando ella vende sus ganancias le han beneficiado para comprar lo que le hace falta en casa y para gastos del hogar, en general todo el grupo está muy agradecido, con FRAC y KIVA por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
The group "Los Arbolitos" (the little trees) is made up of six women and one man. The group is located in the community of Tres Estrellas (three stars). It is a community very far from town. It is a place where transportation is very scarce and, in general, people are dedicated to farming. The name of the group was chosen since one member of the group had planted some small trees where they meet and so this is how they named the group. This time the members have requested the loan to invest in their activities like, for example, Angela will invest in embroidery, Maria Leonely, Placida and Ignacia will buy sheep, Maximino will invest in a grocery store and Magdalena will invest in perfumes. All are very thankful for the loan granted since it will all them to buy all that they lack.

Maura, who is the representative of the group, tells us that she is 47 years old. She has been married for 29 years to Federico who works with her although they have two children who depend on them and who are students, one in elementary school and the other in secondary school. Maura is dedicated to embroidery such as napkins, tablecloths, relgious embroidery, decorations for tables and other furniture. "Since I was a girl, I learned since my mother taught me to embroider but also I liked it a lot since the finished product was very beautiful". This time she has requested the loan to buy thread in different colors, plaid fabric, and needles. The greatest difficulty that Maura faces is selling her embroidery since almost all the women in her community embroider and they do not buy like they did before. But this does not deter her from continuing to make her product since she also shows them on tables for parties like this time when we visit her she was very happy since the son was getting married. One of Maura's goals is to buy sheep and improve her house. When she sells, her earnings are beneficial to buy what she lacks at home and to pay the bills. In general, the whole group is very thankful to FRAC and Kiva for the loan granted.

loans.use: to buy thread, plaid fabric, needles, etc.

loans.name: Jojie Lyn

texts.en:
Jojie Lyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a basket weaving business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her basket weaving business.

Jojie Lyn has been in this business for 5 years. Jojie Lyn earns more income from hog raising.

Jojie Lyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her basket weaving business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 54 years old and married with 3 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Alicia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 3 years.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad C. is from the village of San Juan, Quirino, Isabela. She is 64 years old and widowed. Soledad owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Soledad has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,200 PHP a month from it. 

In 2008, Soledad joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Soledad has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Soledad is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to buy different products that she can sell like snack foods and spices for her store

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es: Isaías de 43 años de edad es originario de Teustepe, casado, padre de 3 hijos los cuales están a su cargo, de oficio agricultor se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos  desde hace 23 años. Inicio su actividad desde muy pequeño pues aprendió a trabajar con el papa a la edad de 10 años le ayudaba a sembrar frijoles y maíz para el consumo propio hoy en día  siembra para vender sus productos  y de las ganancias que saca de la cosecha compra animales, esta ha sido su única actividad y en su tiempo libre trabaja como jornalero en fincas más grandes para conseguir otros ingresos, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de su familia la cual trabaja junto con él , sus productos los comercializa en Boaco. Cuando los productos están muy bajos en los mercados, el  viaja a Costa Rica de Diciembre a Abril para trabajar y recoger dinero que luego invierte en su siembra. El solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para siembras de frijol. Este crédito le ayudara a obtener mejor cosecha  de la cual espera  sacar más cantidad en producción y vender mejor.
texts.en:
Isaías is 43 years old and originally from Teustepe. He is married and the father of three dependent children. Isaías is a farmer by trade and has been growing basic grains for 23 years. He started farming at a very young age. When he was 10 years old, he learned by helping to plant beans and corn, and now he does the same tasks so that he will have products to sell. His profits are used to buy animals and this is his only occupation. In his free time, he works as a laborer on larger farms so that he can earn additional income. His family supports his business since they all work together.

His products are sold in Boaco. When his supply of products is low at the markets, Isaías travels to Costa Rica from December to April to work and earn money that he can eventually reinvest in his crops. He is requesting a loan to buy supplies for planting beans. This loan will help him obtain a better harvest in the hopes of increasing his production and having more to sell.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for planting beans.

loans.name: El Cerrito Group

texts.es: El grupo "El cerrito" esta en un lugar muy pequeño donde el trasporte es muy escaso el grupo se encuantra en lo alto de un cerrito es por eso que asi le pusieron al grupo, comentan los integrantes del grupo que antes ahora era un llanito pero ahoara se ha convertido en un cerrito pequeño, Doña Fransica quien nos otorgo la entrevista tiene 64 años de edad esta casada con el señor Francisco ya no tienen dependientes, doña Francisca se dedica a la crianaza y venta de animales esta vez ha solicitado el credito para comprar 3 borregos pastura y zacate ya que cada mes tiene que comprar. Ella nos comenta que siempre le ha gustado cidarlos, atenderlos ya que de esta manera son como crecen grandes y fuertes esta activiada la aprendio de su mama, el reto mas grande que presenta doña Francisca es en le tiempo de sequia ya que no tiene que darle de comer a sus animales es por esta causa que doña francisca solo en casa tiene 3 y en casa de su hija tiene 5 porque donde vive doña Francisca no hay pasto fresco y en la casa de su hija hay un  poco ya demas porque su nieto saca a pastarlos un rato por las tardes, Doña francisca esta muy agradecida ya que gracias al credito podra comprra la pastura que tanta falta le hace, ademas de la pastura que podra comprar esta vez comprara tambien ha podido emprender una pequeña tienda de dulces en su casa desde que inicio el credito ha estado ahorrando todas sus ganacias y fue asi como pudo poner su negocio. La meta de doña Francisca es mejorar su caliadad de vida y no estar tan preocupados por dinero ya que cuando se enferma ella o su esposo no tienen dinero para solventar los gastos para medicamentos, mientras que doña Francisca podra invertir en los borrego, don Alfredo, Doña Natlia, doña Marcela, doña Victoria, doña Leticia, Doña Tomasa tambien invertiran en borregos, todos en general estan muy agradecidos por el credito otorgado ya que podran comprar sus animalitos.
texts.en:
The "El cerrito" group is located in a very small community where transportation is very limited. The group is located at the top of a hill (cerrito). The members of the group mention that in the past, it was a plain but it has converted into a little hill. Francisca is 64 years old. She is married to Francisco. They do not have any dependents. Francisca raises and sells animals. This time, she has requested a loan in order to purchase three sheep and feed since she has to purchase it every month. 
She says that she always liked to take care of animals.  Taking care of them in this way lets the animals grow big and strong. She learned these skills from her mother. The biggest challenge that Francisca faces is during the drought since she cannot feed her animals.  For this reason, Francisca only has three sheep at her house. There are five at her daughter’s house.  There are no fresh pastures where Francisca lives. There are a few where her daughter lives. Her grandson also takes them out to the pastures in the afternoon. Francisca is very grateful because thanks to the loan, she will be able to purchase pasture land. In addition to the land, she can start her small candy shop. Since the start of the loan, she has been saving all of her earnings. With these, she can put money into the shop. Francisca’s goals are to improve her quality of life and to not be so preoccupied about money when she or her husband gets sick and they don’t have money to pay medication expenses. While Francisca will invest in the sheep, Alfredo, Natila, Marcela, Victoria Leticia and Tomasa also will invest in sheep. In general, all the members are very grateful for the granted loan since they can now purchase their little animals.

loans.use: purchase sheep and pastures.

loans.name: Louie

texts.en:
Louie is 24 years old and married with 2 children. With one child in school, Louie works very hard to provide for them.

Louie runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell for her sari-sari store.

Louie has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future Louie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell for her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 48 years old, married and has three children. Together with her spouse, she is raising them to be responsible and humble. Now, all their children have earned a degree. Merlita and her spouse earn their living by operating a store selling grocery items and a farming business. They have worked hard to meet their family's daily consumption.

Now, Merlita would like to increase her sales so she needs to stock more grocery items in her store such as sardines, eggs, biscuits, soap and shampoo. She is borrowing a loan of P30,000 to buy these merchandise. With good profits from their businesses, they will soon achieve a better way of living.

loans.use: to buy sardines, eggs, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell in her store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 36 years old and married with 4 children. With 3 children in school, Rosa works very hard to provide for them.

Rosa runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Rosa has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, soft drinks, detergent, soap and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Rosa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 35 years old and has 3 children. Mila is married and two of her children are in school.

Mila is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Mila requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mila has been farming vegetable for 7 years now and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her farm.

In the future, Mila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Aritas

texts.en:
Aritas works hard to support her family. Aritas is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Aritas requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell. She has been in this business for 14 years now.

In the future, Aritas would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Silverio Marcial

texts.es:
Silverio es un hombre muy trabajador, junto a su esposa tiene 2 hijos los cuales tienen 16 y 5 años, son lo mejor que tiene en la vida y por ellos el se esfuerza mucho para salir adelante y demostrarles que con trabajo y honradez se puede llegar a ser una persona de bien cada día; su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de los Aquijes el cual es muy conocido por que allí se encuentran grandes Bodegas productoras del licor bandera de nuestro país el cual es el Pisco; asimismo en este distrito se realiza la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, maíz, entre otros; asimismo se caracteriza por la amabilidad de sus pobladores. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta leer y también aprovecha para disfrutar un de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Lomo Saltado”. El solo pudo estudiar hasta el cuarto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser profesor de Historia y Geografía.

Día a Día Silverio trabaja como chofer de taxi, principalmente realiza el servicio de colectivo hacia su distrito desde la el centro de la ciudad hacia sus alrededores, se dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes.

Silverio está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehiculó; con esta mejora tendrá un vehiculó en buen estado para el transporte de pasajeros y evitara que pueda ocurrirle algún accidente por fallas mecánicas, así el seguirá trabajando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Silverio is a hardworking gentleman. He and his wife have two children, ages 16 and 5. They are the best things he has in life, so he strives very hard to move forward. Through his work and his honesty, he demonstrates each day that he can become a successful person. His home is located in the District of Los Aquijes, which is well-known for its large distilleries where "pisco" (grape brandy), the national liquor of Peru, is made. This area is also known for agriculture, especially the cultivation of cotton, grapes, corn, and other crops. The residents are known for their friendliness. Whenever he has free time, Silverio enjoys reading and savoring his favorite dish known as "lomo saltado" (Peruvian steak and potatoes), which is quite flavorful. Silverio only completed high school up to the fourth year. He would have liked to have continued his studies in order to become a history and geography teacher.

Each day, Silverio works as a taxi driver. He mainly provides service within his district, ranging from the central part of the city out to the surrounding areas. Silverio works approximately 10 hours each day. He believes he is doing well in his business because he is very friendly with his customers.

Silverio is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they will provide, he will be able to pay for general maintenance for his vehicle. As a result, he will have a vehicle that is in good condition and suitable for transporting passengers. This will help him avoid an accident caused by mechanical failures. Silverio will continue working so that he can achieve his greatest dream of having a house of his own.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma, 40 years old, has a business selling "ukay-ukay" (used clothes) at San Jose where her family lives. She is married and has two children. Aside from clothing sales, another source of income comes from backyard hog raising. Vilma has operated her clothing sales business for over five years now. She was happy to generate income from it for her children's education. She would like to sell more clothes so she is asking for a loan to have additional capital for buying  used clothes, shoes and bags to sell. She needs P15,000. Part of the loan will also be used for buying hog feed for sustenance.
 
Vilma's goal in life is to keep growing as an entreprenuer in order to give the best education to her two children. She will be happy and proud to see them professionals in their chosen carreer someday.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes, shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is 60 years old, married with 7 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Brigida has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Brigida requested a PHP 19,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Brigida has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, Brigida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Uldarica

texts.en:
Uldarica is 46 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising hogs in the Philippines. Uldarica is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Uldarica has been in hog raising for 5 years and also earns additional income from basket weaving.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
A very supportive mother of three grown-up children. Raquel, 42 years old, lives in the village of San Juan, province of Isabela. Raquel manages her own store with her husband Johnny. Aside from their store, her spouse is also a simple farmer in their village. They both help each other to support their family. 

Raquel is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy a variety of products that she can offer in the community. She hopes that someday her business will be bigger so that she can supply the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy spices, coffee, noodles, drinks and soap for her store

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca (natural plant fiber) weaving business in the Philippines.

Agripina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca weaving business. She has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future, Agripina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Evelita

texts.en:
Evelita is 52 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed for her pigs.

Evelita has been raising pigs for 28 years and also earns additional income from firewood sales.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Jerrilyn

texts.en:
Jerrilyn is 32 years old and married with one child.

Jerrilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Jerrilyn has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from her barbeque stand.

Jerrilyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Campo Verde Group

texts.es:
El grupo  se llama campo verde y se integra de tres señoras quienes  viven en  el  barrio llamado la salida ya  que  es una carretera que va al pueblo de Ocotepec.
Quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama  Antonia  quien  es divorciada  y tuvo  dos hijos quienes  ya están casados.
Ella se  dedica   a la elaboración de tostadas con crema,  en donde lleva trabajando  seis  años seis  meses en al que cometa que el va  bien ya que con ello  ha logrado generar ingresos en su hogar.
Inicio con esta actividad para a poyarse ya que se quedo solo y para apoyar a su  hijos  tenía que dedicarse a  algo  que le deje ingresos.
Lo  que más  desea es que con el préstamo y su negocio logre seguir adelante  y así seguir apoyando  a sus hijos quienes están casados pero a un viven en la casa de ella.
Quienes integran en el grupo son: Rosaura  quien invertirá el préstamo  en la compra de mercancía para surtir su negocio de abarrotes y la señora Amelia invertirá en la compra de  mercancía para su negocio  de abarrotes.
texts.en:
The group called “Campo Verde,” or “Green Fields,” is composed of three women who live in the La Salida neighborhood, which is off of a road that goes to the town of Ocotepec. 

The woman who is being interviewed is Antonia. She is divorced and has two married children. She has been making tostadas with crema [fried tortillas with toppings such as beans, chicken, lettuce, onion, and cilantro, with Mexican cream] for six years and six months, and she says that it has been going well since it has allowed her to earn income for her family. She decided to start this work to be able to support herself after becoming single. In order to support her children, she had to find work that would give her an income.

What she wants most from the loan and the business is to get ahead in life and continue supporting her children, who are married but continue to live at home with her. 

The other members of the group are Rosaura and Amelia. Rosaura who will invest the loan in merchandise to stock her grocery store. Amelia will also invest in merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.use: Purchase the ingredients to make tostadas

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo tiene 41 años de edad, es padre de familia, agricultor, muy  trabajador y vive en una comunidad  situada en  la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas, llamada La Danta.  La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
El está solicitando un préstamo de ₡500.000 (quinientos mil colones), para la compra de semilla de maíz,  abono y fungicidas para proteger sus cultivos durante el proceso de producción .  Con estos abonos, Gerardo aumentará la capacidad que posee el suelo de absorber los distintos elementos nutritivos y con los fungicidas que utilizara gracias a este préstamo también evitara que aparezcan hongos en sus plantaciones,  así brindara productos de calidad a sus clientes,  y además podrá hacer frente a las obligaciones financieras.

El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de la Danta S.A, una de las 110 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica y este es su segundo crédito.
texts.en:
Gerardo, age 41, is a very hard-working farmer.  He lives in a community that is situated in the southern part of Costa Rica.  The community is called La Danta, and it is in Concepción Pilas, Puntarenas.

The local economy is based on farming activities.  Growing tubers, coffee, corn, beans, and raising livestock stand out.

He is requesting a loan for 500,000 (five hundred thousand) colones in order to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and fungicides to protect his crops during the production process.  With these fertilizers and fungicides Gerardo will increase the capacity that the ground has to absorb different nutritive elements.  Thanks to this loan he will also avoid the fungi that appear on his crops.  That way he will offer quality products to his customers.  He will also be able to deal with his financial obligations.

He is a member of the La Danta S.A. communal bank, one of Costa Rica’s 150 communal credit firms, and this is his second loan.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine works hard to support her family. Geraldine is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a backup light during emergencies.

Geraldine is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money,  she is helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca (local plant fiber) weaving business in the Philippines.

Josefina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business. She has been in this business for 30 years.

In the future, Josefina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Leodigaria

texts.en:
Leodigaria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 30 years.

In the future, Leodigaria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca works hard to support her family. Francisca is married and has a spice retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more spices to sell in her food stall. She has been in this business for 13 years.

In the future, Francisca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase jewelry, clothing, bags, and exhibitors.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora, 52, is a sari-sari store (community-based store) owner in the village of San Juan province of Isabela, where she is married to Loreto, a farmer and a driver of a passenger tricycle in their village. The couple has three children: Brena, already married; Eveth, and the youngest, Loreto Jr., now helping his father on their farm and with the tricycle operation. 

Aurora is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 for the expansion of her business. She plans to sell meat and other products that will cater to the needs of her customers and also buy more groceries for her store. She is hoping for a continuous development in her business for the benefit of her family. 

Aurora is saving money for times of emergency and believes that with her dedication, she will somehow become successful, always keeping in mind the axiom, “Try and try until you succeed.”

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Gilma

texts.es:
Gilma 
600.000
2012-94
	 Gilma es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora, en su natal Nicaragua obtuvo el bachillerato y estudio contabilidad, pero ante la situación de pobreza y buscando un mejor porvenir para sus hijos, llegó a Costa Rica hace cerca de 20 años. Adquirió con esfuerzo y trabajo su casa propia donde vive con su compañero e hijos, está muy interesada en poner en práctica sus conocimientos en belleza y administrar su propio negocio,  dado su estudio en contabilidad y capacitaciones en el área de belleza.
	 Con la ayuda de sus familiares y esfuerzo propio se ha capacitado y adquirido equipos necesarios para el trabajo de belleza y barbería. Requiere de un capital para comprar una silla de barbero, un lava cabezas, espejos, acondicionar la iluminación del local, entre otras, con el objetivo de abrir sus puertas y ofrecer este servicio junto a su socia.
	Se realiza una proyección de ingresos, de acuerdo a la experiencia de la clienta en trabajos anteriores, además de la información elaborada en un curso de microempresa al que asistió. 

Ella se levanta temprano y alista el almuerzo de sus hijos y compañero y envía a su hija menor a la escuela. Después se va a su salón, donde trabaja de 9 am a 5 pm, regresando a su casa al final del día.
Se capacitó en el área de belleza y barbería y junto a una compañera que se especializa en masaje y pies;  deciden abrir el salón en la zona de San Antonio del Tejar en Alajuela, Se ha trabajado en esta rama desde el 2009 y se presentan los títulos que la acreditan para el desarrollo de la actividad. Los que ha llevado con el apoyo del Ministerio de Educación de Costa Rica. Su sueño es tener una cadena de salones en la zona donde  reside.
texts.en:
Gilma is a hard-working woman. In her native Nicaragua, she obtained a baccalaureate and studied accounting but to due to poverty and looking for a better future for her children, she came to Costa Rica close to twenty years ago. With effort and work she acquired her own home where she lives with her spouse and their children. She is very interested in putting into practice her beauty knowledge and to manage her own business, given her accounting education and her abilities in the area of beauty.

With the help of her family and her own effort, she has qualified and acquired the necessary equipment for beauty and barber work. She needs some capital to buy a barber chair, a hair washing sink, mirrors, and to fix the lighting in the shop, among other things, with the objective of opening her doors and offering this service along with her friend.

She completed an income projection in accordance with experience with customers from previous jobs, in addition to information gained from a microenterprise course that helped her.

She rises early and readies lunch for her children and spouse and sends her young daughter to school. Later she goes to her salon where she works from 9AM to 5PM, returning home at the end of the day. She trained in the area of beauty and barbering and along with a colleague who specializes in massage and feet, they decided to open a salon in the area of San Antonio del Tejar in Alajuela. She has worked in this branch since 2009 and has been accredited with the titles for the development of this activity, which has the support of the Ministry of Education of Costa Rica. Her dream is to have a chain of salons in the area where she lives.

loans.use: to fix the electric installation in her shop and to acquire mirrors, a barber chair and hair washing sinks.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, 52 years old, is a very jolly and responsible parent of three grown up children from the mountainous province of Isabela. 

She has been engaged in raising hogs for two years. She fattens them and sells them to have income and sustain her family. 

She is asking a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy feed and piglets to expand her business so that she can sustain her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets to grow for her business

loans.name: Ma. Susan

texts.en:
Ma. Susan manages a little sari-sari store (community-based store) in her village. Managing her store is her way of helping her husband generate income for their family needs. She sells a variety of goods in her store, where she earns at least 800 PHP a day. To further develop her store, Susan is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000. She plans to use the loan to purchase groceries in bulk that she will sell in her store. She wants to sustain her business because it assists not only their family, but also their farming needs.

Susan is already fifty years old and is married to Efren, a farmer in their community. They live in the village of San Juan in the province of Isabela. The couple has been blessed with three children: Pol Nino, Paul John, and Zaira, the youngest. Susan hopes that with their sacrifices for their businesses, they may able to continue support their children’s education until they finish college.

loans.use: to purchase groceries in bulk to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is 28 years old, married and has two young children. His wife is a housekeeper. 

To earn a living, Dennis makes use of his skills in vehicle repairs. He has been able to gain PHP 500 a day doing this work. 

He is now borrowing a loan of PHP 7,000 to have additional capital to maintain his business. He will buy tires and machine oils for his shop. He promises to pay back his loan. 

Dennis keeps on earning funds for his children's school expenses. He hopes to provide the best education for them.

loans.use: to buy tires and machine oils for maintenance of the vehicle repair shop.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina 
800.000
2012-92

	Cristina tiene 30 años de edad, actualmente vive con su compañero y su hija de 5 años, vive en la zona de Horquetas de Sarapiqui.  La solicitante tiene un importante historial dentro de Fundación Mujer, en la comunidad fue la artífice de la formación de un grupo  formado por jóvenes emprendedoras de la zona;  cancelaron con puntualidad el  crédito otorgado. Ella decide  optar por un monto mayor por lo que va a solicitar éste préstamo. Anteriormente  se invirtió el dinero en la cría  de pollos, la cual se ha venido manejando desde hace 3 años. Actualmente junto a su esposo, se dedican al comercio de tenis de marca, por lo que el capital solicitado irá dirigido a la compra de esta mercadería y seguir atendiendo los pollos.
	La actividad le ha  permitido generar ingresos para cubrir el pago del préstamo y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. En este caso particular se desea retomar la actividad de comercio ya que maneja una cartera de clientes en la zona, cubrir los pedidos y seguir apoyando los ingresos familiares. Entre las labores diarias de Cristina esta llevar a su hija a la escuela y atender al alimentación de los pollos y además cuenta con una cerda de cría, en las tardes junto a su compañero, en el vehículo de la familia, se dedican a la venta de ambos productos (pollos y tenis), en las comunidades cercanas.
	 Es el tercer crédito que se  solicita, el primero de forma individual, se ha demostrado una conducta de pago muy buena, y la actividad comercial a venido en aumento; según los datos recopilados en la visita a la microempresa
	Se cuenta con los gallineros y un congelador para el almacenamiento de los pollos, existe en la zona un restaurante y una soda que compra los mismos, además de los vecinos de la comunidad. Con respecto a la actividad de venta de zapatos deportivos,  esta es manejada junto a su esposo, es complementaria a los pollos. Se cuenta con una cartera de clientes desde hace 5 años, y se pretende realizar una inversión importante para cubrir los pedidos. Las tenis son de marca y se adquieren en la frontera de Paso Canoas (Panamá)a un precio muy competitivo y dando facilidades de pago.
texts.en:
Cristina is 30 years old and currently lives with her husband and 5-year old daughter in the Horquetas de Sarapiqui area. She has an important historical role in Fundación Mujer as she was the reason a group of young entrepreneurs was formed in the community. They paid off their loan promptly. Cristina has decided to seek a larger loan. Last time she used the money to raise chickens and has been doing this for three years.  As she and her husband also sell brand name sneakers, the new loan will be used to buy these items, and Cristina will continue to raise chickens.

 This job has enabled her to earn money to pay off the loan and improve the standard of living of her family. Now she wishes to invest in the business again as she has orders from customers in the area. This would bring more money into the household. Cristina’s daily chores consist of getting her daughter ready for school, feeding the chickens and a pig she is also raising. In the afternoon she and her husband take the family vehicle and go off to sell both the chickens and the sneakers in nearby communities. 

This will be Cristina’s third individual loan. She has demonstrated responsibility in repaying the money each time, and her business is doing well according to data collected in a visit to her small business.  She owns henhouses and a fridge for the chicken food. A neighbourhood restaurant and coffee shop buy chickens from her, as do people in the community. The sales of sneakers are done by both her and her husband alongside sales of chickens. She has had a group of regular customers for five years, and she hopes to make a large investment so she can fill her customers’ orders. The sneakers are brand name obtained from the border at Paso Canoas, Panama, for a competitive price on credit.

loans.use: to buy brand name sneakers

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda  has the drive and attitude to succeed. She is married and blessed with four children. 

Glenda makes use of her skills in cooking food to sell and generate income from it. She cooks food for daily meals and snacks such as "pancit" (noodles in Filipino cuisine). She earns about PHP 8,000 each month. Glenda is very happy providing good customer service and delicious foods from her business. 

She would like to keep making better sales, so she is now borrowing a loan of PHP 30,000 to invest in her business. She will buy ingredients such as pork meat, vegetables and eggs.

Glenda's goal is to make a better life for her family. She would like to keep earning good profits from her business. She is also hoping to establish a more convenient food stall location someday.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as pork meat, vegetables and eggs to use in the food selling business.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat is fifty-one years old. She is married and resides with her husband and three children in Seim Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in an agricultural business for more than ten years, has an extensive experience and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice and vegetables, and fattening up cattle. Approximately, she earns $ 3 per day. Her husband runs a taxi service (motor taxi). He earns about $7 per day. All of her children are still in her care and in school. 

Phat is requesting a loan of $350 to pay to connect her house to the electricity system. This money will help her family got electricity to use and hence to improve their living conditions. In the future, she would like to purchase a Tuk Tuk for her husband's taxi service because a Tuk Tuk taxi service makes much more money than a motor taxi. Moreover, she hopes to help her children earn bachelor’s degrees and get a good jobs.

loans.use: to pay to connect her house to the electricity system.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is forty-four years old, married, with four school age children. Renato has three hectares of rice fields which he plants. He has been a farmer for twenty-eight years. He earns approximately PHP 100,000 for each crop however he only brings home half of this because after selling his harvest, he has to pay his debts to the traders, the private-sector who lends to small farmers from villages at high interest rates. 

Renato dreams of improving his family's standard of living. He wants to borrow PHP 50,000 to buy fertilizers, seeds and herbicides. He hopes the loan will be a big help for him. By taking this loan, we will not need to get a loan from the traders. So instead of paying high interest rates to the traders, he can spend his money on his children's food and education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and herbicides.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
She is a woman with courage and a mother of five children. Letecia is fifty-six years of age and already a widow. Letecia’s husband died two years ago, but Letecia did not lose her hope of living happily. Her children are her inspiration to move on and continue to live.

With the help of her children, at her age, Letecia can still manage her rice farming business well. Letecia dreams of having her own savings. She doesn’t want to rely only on her children because someday her children will have their own family. 

Letecia’s earnings from her rice crop are not enough to provide for her needs for the next crop. Thus, she is requesting a loan of PHP 27,000 to buy farm inputs like rice seeds, fertilizers and herbicides that she will use in rice farming. The loan will be a big help for her as it will allow her to purchase the farm inputs she needs. She hopes of gaining a higher income so she can fulfill her dream. to provide the farm inputs needed in farming.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like rice seeds, fertilizers and herbicides that she will use in rice farming.

loans.name: Li-An

texts.en:
Li-an is a loving and hard working mother of two. Her children are going to elementary school. Li-an's priority in life is to give the opportunity to her children to study and achieve their dreams. She has no other treasure to give rather than education. 

Li-an manages her two hectares, and plants rice on them. She has been three years in this type of business. According to her, she will not get tired of doing field activities because she loves her work. She said that it is the main source of income for the family.

Li-an needs additional working capital for her field. Her income from the previous crop was not enough to buy all the farm inputs needed in rice farming. Now, Li-an has decided to acquire a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, hybrid rice seeds, insecticides and herbicides. She will use the loan wisely and manage well her farm. She hopes to become a successful farmer, an entrepreneur as well as a borrower.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, hybrid rice seeds, insecticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Princesas Group

texts.es: Este grupos se llama Princesas, está conformado por las señoras Celia y Maria Juliana van a comprar con su préstamo azúcar, huevo, aceite, jabón, enlatados, refrescos, dulces, la señora Diana va a comprar aloe, malteadas, tés, fibra, la señora Cipriana va a comprar aguacate, pera, durazno, ciruela, la señora Olga va a comprar playeras, chamarras, pantalones y lencería. La señora Celia tiene 57 años de edad, ella es casada, ella tiene 2 hijos un varón y una mujer, los dos mayores de edad, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar jabón, azúcar, aceite, sopas, papel higiénico, huevo, arroz, refrescos, chiles en vinagre y dulces, ella inicio su negocio hace 8 meses con un préstamo, su negocio es importante porque se va ayudando para la comida, a ella le gusta este negocio se sien útil, le gusta trabajar atender a sus clientes bien para que regresen a trabajar, ella se siente feliz de ver que vende sus productos y tiene ingresos para la comida. Ella esta contenta con el préstamo que va a recibir porque va a comprar mercancía para ampliar su negocio y dar mejor servicio al cliente. Sus sueños y esperanzas son que sus negocio crezca y que su familia este bien  de salud y contenta. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad  “les damos las gracias por sus préstamos,  esperamos nos sigan ayudando con sus préstamos para que sigamos creciendo en los negocios”.
texts.en:
This group called Princesas includes Celia and Maria Juliana who are going to buy with the money from their loan sugar, eggs, oil, soap, canned goods, soft drinks, and sweets. Diana is going to buy aloe, smoothies, teas, and fiber products. Cipriana is going to buy avocados, pears, peaches, and plums. Olga will buy shirts, jackets, trousers and lingerie. 

Celia is 57 years old, married and she has 2 children, male and female, both adult. She has a grocery store. She is asking for a loan in order to buy soap, sugar, oil, soups, toilet paper, eggs, rice, soft drinks, chiles preserved in vinegar, and sweets. She began her business 8 months ago with a loan. Her business is important because it helps her buy food. She likes this business and feels useful. She likes serving her customers well so they return to her store. She feels happy to to see that her products are selling and she has income to buy food.

She is happy with the loan that she is going to receive because she is going to buy merchandise in order to expand her business and give better service to her customers. Her dreams and hopes are that the business grows and that her family is happy and healthy. The members of the group want to say thank you to Kiva and the Fundación Realidad: “thank you for your loans, we hope that you continue helping with loans for the growth of the businesses.”

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, oil, soup, toilet paper, eggs, rice, soft drinks, chiles preserved in vinegar, oatmeal, sweets, and fruit

loans.name: Edesa

texts.en:
Edesa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an Internet cafe business in the Philippines. Edesa has been in this business for five years. Edesa earns additional income from videoke rentals and hog raising.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy computer supplies and feed for her pigs.

Edesa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies and feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Virgelen

texts.en:
Virgelen, 37, is married with three children; two are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Virgelen has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

Virgelen requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her motorcycle transportation business.

In the future, Virgelen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana  es una mujer de 42 años de edad, estado civil casada, con 03 hijos. Vive  en casa con su cónyuge, La casa está ubicada en el caserío Luis Sánchez Cerro  distrito de Tambogrande y cuenta con servicio de luz, el lugar es una ciudad de aproximadamente 100 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Susana es  la venta de productos Naturales, también se dedica a  la venta de salchipollos en su domicilio. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 02 años aproximadamente,  y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce este tipo de negocio. 
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 3000 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en la compra de productos Naturales  y compra de insumos para la preparación de comida, y  poder atender a sus clientes en esta zona, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Susana is a woman 42 years of age, married with three children. She lives in a house with her spouse. The house is located in the Luis Sanchez Cerro farm in the Tambogrande district and has light service. The place is a city of approximately 100 families. The activity that Susana is developing is selling natural products. She is also dedicated to selling "salchipollos" from her house. She's been doing this activity for approximately two years and learn it from her parents, who know this type of business. The amount of the loan requested is 3000 new "soles" which will be used to invest in the purchase of natural products and to buy ingredients to prepare food and to be able to attend to her customers in the area which will allow here to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase natural products and ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Luis Hernan

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre  de 43 años de edad, estado conviviente, con 02 hijos. Vive en casa con su cónyuge, La casa está ubicada en el caserío Santa Rosa distrito de Morropòn y cuenta con servicio de luz, el lugar es una ciudad de aproximadamente 120 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Luis es  brindar servicio de electricidad en la zona. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 06 años aproximadamente,  y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce este tipo de negocio. 
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 1500 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en la compra de herramientas de trabajo (escalera, sogas, cables, casco) y otros complementos que brinden un buen servicio, y  poder atender a sus clientes en esta zona, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Luis is a man of 43 years of age, married with two children. He  lives in a house with his spouse. The house is located in the Santa Rosa farm, district of Morropon and has light service. The place is a city of approximately 120 families. The activity that Luis develops is to provide electrician service in the area.  He has performed this activity for approximately six years and learned it from his parents who know this type of work. The amount of the requested loan is 1,500 new "soles", which will be used to invest in the purchase of tools  for work (ladder, rope, cables, helmet) and other supplements that provide good service and to be able to attend to his customers in the area which will allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase electricity tools.

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:
Carlito is forty-nine years of age, married, and has four children. Carlito’s wife is a housekeeper. Carlito is a farmer and manages three hectares which he plants with rice. He has been in this business for nearly twenty-three years. Carlito’s goal in life is to uplift his family's standard of living.

Carlito’s way of uplifting his family's standard of living is to strive, work hard and love his work, which is farming. Carlito's income from the business goes on his children's education. He knows that he has no other treasure to give his children other than education.

Carlito is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and pay for labor and land preparation. He hopes to get the loan and he will use it wisely to ensure a better future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and pay for the labor and land preparation.

loans.name: Samon

texts.en:
Samon is forty-one years old. She is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling sugarcane juice for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker. Additionally, he runs a motorbike wash shop to earn more money to support the family. He earns about $7 per day. One of her children is employed in the Cultural Village and earns about $3 per day. 

In order to improve her shop, Samon is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase construction materials to rebuild her shop to make it bigger. This money will help her expand her shop and earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her shop to make it bigger.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is thirty-five years old, married, and blessed with four children. His wife is a housekeeper and his partner in managing their rice farming business. He has been fifteen years in this business. He shared that he was only in his twenties when he learned how to do farming from his parents. Joel did not have the chance to go to college which is why he strives to give his children the opportunity of going to college and finishing their studies. Joel does this because he believes that education is the key to success.

Joel wishes to extend his farm area to gain a higher yield and earnings. Due to insufficient funds, Joel has not been able to make his wish reality. However, he did not loose his hope of making his dream come true some day. He believes that there is always a right time to get what you dream of in the right way. 

Because of the high cost of farm inputs such as fertilizer, rice seeds, herbicides and insecticides, Joel decided to take a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy farm inputs needed in rice farming and to pay for the cost of labor.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs needed in rice farming and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es:
El señor Margarito de 72 años de edad es originario de la comunidad San Lorenzo-Boaco actualmente vive en Teustepe, de oficio agricultor, casado, padre de 7 hijos todos mayores de edad de vida independiente. El se dedica a la siembra de Maíz y frijol actividad que inicio desde hace 50 años trabajando con el papa en la agricultura y ganadería desde los 10 años de edad, luego a  los 25 años de edad decidió independizarse empezó a sembrar 4 manzanas de frijol y 5 manzanas de maíz y trigo, el se siente muy satisfecho en esta  actividad pues le ha ido muy bien a comprado tierras y ganados. Cuenta con otros ingresos los provenientes de la venta de terneros, sus productos los comercializa en su misma comunidad  aunque le gustaría darlos a conocer en otros lugares debido a que lo pagan a un mejor precio.
Solicita el préstamo para mejorar los cercos para que no pase el ganado a los cultivos y reforzar su  actividad para mejores resultados el cual estima el préstamo le ayudara ya que tendrá mayor producción y con el mejoramiento de los cercos podrá evitar que sus animales ocasionen daños en sus cultivos, sus planes futuros es comprar más tierras, trabajarla en agricultura y ganadería.
texts.en:
Margarito is 72 years old and from the community of San Lorenzo-Boaco. Right now he lives in Teustepe. He is a farmer, married and the father of 7 children who are all grown and on their own. He plants corn and beans, something he started doing 50 years ago, working with potatoes and cattle since he was ten years old. Later, when he was 25 years old, he decided to go off on his own and started planting beans and corn and wheat. He is very satisfied with this activity because it has gone very well for him and he has bought land and cattle. He has other income from selling calves. He sells in his own community although he likes to go to other places because they pay a better place.  

He is asking for the loan to improve the fences so that his cattle won't go onto his crops and get better results. He believes the loan will help him because he will have better production and the improvement of the fences will avoid damages to the crops from the animals. His plans for the future are to buy more land and work it with his crops and cattle.

loans.use: to improve fences.

loans.name: Alma Lucia

texts.es: Alma Lucia  tiene la edad de 53 años, su estado civil es casado. Doña Lucia tiene 2 hijos. La actividad económica de es un taller de carpintería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Alma inicio este negocio por su familia ya que anteriormente el negocio estaba a cargo de su Papa y fue él quien le enseño este negocio y como necesitaba un medio de supervivencia decide hacerse a cargo del negocio. El propósito de Alma es mantener activo este negocio, El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo por lo que su inversión será destinada para la compra de materia prima como madera, pintura, brocha, pega, lija entre otros. Los sueños de Doña Alma es seguir trabajando con Fundación León 2000 y mantener su herramienta de trabajo para su progreso económico.
texts.en: Alma Lucia is 53 years old. Her civil state is married. Lucia has two children. Her economic activity is a carpentry shop. For more than five years, she has been dedicated to this business. Alma started this business for her family since previously the business was managed by her father and it was he who taught her the business and since she needed a means to survive she decided to make herself in charge of the business. Alma's purpose is to keep this business alive. The loan is destined to be working capital for which the investment will be destined to purchase raw material like wood, paint, brush, glue, sandpaper, among other things. Alma's dreams are to continue working with Fundacion Leon 2000 and to maintain her tools of the job for her economic progress.

loans.use: to buy raw material like wood, paint, brush, glue, sandpaper, among others.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is from the village of San Juan. She is 49 years old, married and has two adult children. 

Amelita owns and operates a general store. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it. 

Amelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Amelita is requesting a new loan of PHP 25,000, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is married. His wife is a housekeeper. Although he hoped to have a child with his wife, Romeo was not blessed with any children. At the age of sixty-one, Romeo is getting old. His dream is to have good health and to make some savings for the future emergencies that will happen to him and to his wife. 

Romeo has been running a rice farming business in the Philippines for twenty-five years. He always does his best to ensure that his crop is in good condition to get high yields. The risks he encountered in farming are drought, pests, typhoons and floods, all of which have an impact on how much he can earn. 

Romeo is requesting a loan of PHP 27,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for plant care. Applying all of this in farming will have a positive result on his production and will allow him to gain a higher income. He hopes to attain his dream while he runs his rice farming business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for plant care.

loans.name: Lorm

texts.en:
Lorm is thirty-seven years old. She is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in making creel (baskets) to sell for more than six years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $7 per day. One of her children is employed as a sanitation worker and earns about $2 per day. 

Due to the difficulties her family has in transportation, Lorm is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase will help her reduce her transportation expenses and save money to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business so he can become a construction foreman and she would also like to help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new bigger house to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: Blanca Yadira

texts.es: Blanca Yadira es una emprendedora que se le ha brindado financiamiento para aumentar su inversión para la venta de mercadería en general, y poder ofrecerle a sus clientes variedad de productos, este negocio surge de la necesidad que tenia la emprendedora de apoyar en los gastos del hogar y brindarle a su familia lo mejor  a su familia. La emprendedora nos expresa que con el financiamiento ha aumentado su inversión y sus clientes que ahora tiene  le  ha realizado varios pedidos que  tiene que entregar, y está solicitando nuevamente crédito para comprar sandalias, pantalones, camisas, faldas, short, entre otros productos que le solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en: Blanca Yadira is a businesswoman who has been fortunate enough to receive financing to increase her investment to sell general merchandise and who can therefore offer her clients a wide range of products.  Her business arose out of her need to help with the household expenses and to give her family the best.  She tells us that with the loan, she has been able to increase her investment, and her current clients have made various orders that she has to deliver, so she is seeking further credit to buy sandals, pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, and other products wanted by her clients.

loans.use: to buy sandals, pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, and other products that her clients want.

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es:
Abelardo  es un hombre de 33 años de edad, estado civil soltero, Vive  en casa  propia  con su s padres. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Tupac Amaru  del  distrito de la Matanza y cuenta con servicio de luz, agua, desagüe, el lugar es una comunidad  de aproximadamente 500 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Abelardo es el servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi en la zona; también se dedica a la agricultura  posee su terreno  (1.0 has) y tiene instalado Fréjol  variedad Zarandaja, donde presenta buen desarrollo fenològico. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 4 años aproximadamente,  y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 1008 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en  la compra de pesticidas, bioestimulantes y pago de jornales   del cultivo, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Abelardo is a 33 year old single man. He lives in his own home with his parents. The house is located in the community of Tupac Amaru in the district of   Matanza. It has electricity, running water, sewage. The community has approximately 500 families.   

Abelardo's activity is a passenger transport service in his motorcycle taxi in the area. He is also a farmer and has 1.0 hectares of land. He grows zarandaja beans and has good phenological development. He has done this activity for approximately 4 years and learned it from his parents, so he knows everything about it.

The amount he has asked for is for 1008 nuevos soles. He will use them to invest in buying pesticides, biostimulants and to pay for the labor for the crop. This will allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, biostimulants and to pay for labor to plant his crops.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 30-year-old married woman with one child, who attends school. She operates a kiosk and has been in this business for the last three years. She has not yet identified any challenge to her business. Jackline lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She aspires to open a shop in the future. She joined Yehu to get funds for her business, and she says that food is her greatest monthly expense. With the requested loan of KES 15,000, she plans to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice for her kiosk.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice for her kiosk.

loans.name: Jimalyn

texts.en:
Jimalyn works hard to support her family. She is single and has a food production business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years.

Jimalyn has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and utensils for her food production business.

In the future, Jimalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for her food production business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 46 years old and married with 7 children. With 3 children in school, Lolita works very hard to provide for her family.

Lolita runs a sari-sari store (general store) in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles, and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy a stock of groceries to sell in her store.

In the future Lolita would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a stock of groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is industrious and a responsible mother to her four children. She is a widower since 2003. Despite her situation as a single parent, Delia didn't stop working hard to sustain her family needs.

Delia owns and runs her home-based general store. She has been in line with this kind of business for more than 5 years. She is grateful because through the income generated from this business, she is able to improve their way of living and provide all her family needs. By this time, three of her children have been settled for marriage and have their own families while the youngest is working. Delia can't really express the happiness she feels nowadays. She knows that God has blessed her a lot.

Delia would like to have continuous improvement of her living condition. For this reason, she is asking for bigger capital in the amount of 40,000 PHP allowing her to buy stock merchandise for her general store. Through this loan amount she would be able to satisfy her costumer demand and economize her expenses in acquiring her merchandise. She hopes that she could have continuous access to financial services from ASKI through the unending support of KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to purchase stock merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is from the village of Capellan. She is thirty-six years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fourteen years and earns approximately PHP 300 a month for these activities. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Delia is requesting a new loan of PHP 15,000 which again will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en: A very hardworking father of four school-aged children from the town of Ilagan province of Isabela. Jerry, 31 years old, manages a store based on the town market with the help of his spouse. To expand his store, he requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional products that he can offer to the customers. And most important is to have additional products so that he can meet the needs of his children in school.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, foods, canned goods and beverages for his store

loans.name: Severina

texts.es: La Sra. Severina  tiene 42 años y es casada con un hijito que tiene la edad de 4 años, ella se dedica  a la venta de comida desde hace ya varios años, y también administra un minibús, que maneja su esposo, ella vive en la zona de Bajo Pampahasi, este préstamo es su cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Severina  va a usar este préstamo para la reparación de su movilidad  ya que está presentando algunas fallas,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es el buen funcionamiento del minibús. La Sra., Severina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia de varios negocios que se dedican a a la venta de comida. Ella va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su movilidad y manteniendo a los pasajeros cómodos y satisfechos . La sueña por su negocio es tener una empresa de transporte interdepartamental. En la foto la Sra. Severina se encuentra en compañia de su esposo y de su hijito.
texts.en: Sra. Severina is 42 and married, with a four-year old son.  For a number of years she has been selling food, and she also runs a minibus, which her husband drives.  She lives in the area of Bajo Pampahasi.  This is her fourth loan cycle with Kiva partner Emprender.  She will use this loan to repair her vehicle, as it has some problems.  Her reason for seeking the loan is to keep the minibus in working order. Severina is facing a number of challenges with her food sales business, namely competition from other food stalls.  She will use her profits to  continue to improve her vehicle and keep all the passengers comfortable and happy.  Her dream for her business is to have a regional transport company.  In the photo, Severina is pictured with her husband and son.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para el fortalecimiento del negocio, pues considera que este aporte es importante para el crecimiento de su producción de tortillas; Ella comprara maíz y leña por mayor cantidad para tener  reserva.
Ella manifiesta que se decidió por este préstamo, debido al buen trabajo que realizo con el anterior, ya que ha estabilizado su negocio y los ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is seeking a new loan to strengthen her business, since she thinks this money is important for her tortilla-making enterprise to grow.  She will buy a  large quantity of corn and firewood in order to have a reserve stock.

She says she decided to ask for this loan because of the success of her previous one, which helped her to stabilize her business and her family's income.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of corn and firewood.

loans.name: Earn

texts.en:
Earn is 55 years old. She is widowed and resides with four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in making creel to sell and fattening up pigs. She earns about 6 USD per day. Three of her children are employed; as a construction worker, a farm worker and a seller. They earn about 10 USD per day. 

Earn wants to run an additional business in order to improve her family’s finances. Due to lack of funds, Earn is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase farmland to use for agricultural crops cultivation. This money will help her acquire the security to start the business. In the future, she would like to expand her pig farm and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for agricultural crops cultivation

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador has been in the business of raising hogs for 20 years. He is grateful because during the long period of time he has devoted to his business he has been able to cover his family's basic needs.

Dominador is 47 years of age, a married man with four adult children. He would like to earn more income, so he is doing everything possible to improve the growth of his hogs.The income generated from his business is not enough due to the expensive prices of livestock feeds and vaccines. For this reason, he would like to borrow additional capital in the amount of PHP 30,000 to buy feeds and vaccines for his hog-raising business. He is hoping that he will get the requested loan amount, which would allow him to maintain his business and improve the family's way of living.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vaccines for his hog-raising business

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio says, "Hard work and patience are the tools to achieving success in life." He is 34 years of age and happily married.

Rogelio owns and has operated a hog-raising business for two years. He would like to increase his business profits in order to cover all of the household's expenses and to sustain his hogs' daily maintenance. Currently, he is in need of additional capital due to the high cost of feeds and vaccines. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000. With this loan he could improve the growth of his hogs so that they will reach their optimum growth. He believes that his patience and sacrifices will have better results, which will serve his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vaccines for his livestock business

loans.name: Wega Group

texts.en:
Jema, who is in her late 20s, is married with one child who goes to school.  She has been running a retail shop for two years now.  She works from 9.00 am to 8.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to replace missing items and bought a fridge, TV set, and empty crates of sodas. Jema has paid back all of her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to increase her shop's inventory. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Wega," which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of products for resale

loans.name: Chao

texts.en:
Chao is 49, a married woman who has been living in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She has a life partner and has four children, all of whom are already married and live independently. Chao is a rice farmer as well as a white wine distiller who has been operating these processes for nearly 13 years. She sells her wine to local villagers. 

For additional income, Chao has built a wooden pigpen in her yard and fattens a few pigs for sale. Due to insufficient funds, she is now asking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase additional pigs to sustain her business and her living. For her prospect, she hopes to expand her business, provide a good standard of living for the family and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to sustain her business and her living.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin is a forty-one-year-old married father of four children. Franklin manages a two-hectare rice field in his village. He wants to take a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy rice seeds and fertilizers to put on his crops so he will have a better yield. The loan will be a big help for him in obtaining the farm inputs needed in his farm. Franklin hopes to get a better yield from this crop and gain higher income. 

In the future, Franklin wants to see his children finish their education thanks to the profits he will make from farming. He hopes to develop his expertise in farming and maintain the business while managing it.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a twenty-two-year-old single man who has been working in his grocery store for five years. Mohamad is a hard worker, he is well known in the region and has a good reputation for giving special care to his customers. 

Although he has a degree in accounting, Mohamad started his business because he encountered obstacles to finding employment due to his nationality. This was a big problem for him and so he set up his own business which he aims to expand so that he can achieve his goals and bring happiness to his family.

Mohamad is taking his first step towards expanding his business through applying for his first Youth loan from KIva partner Al Majmoua. He wants to take advantage of special offers to increase his stock of soft drinks, candies and detergents.

This loan will help a lot in to increase his net profits and his income through attracting new customers because of his special and attractive prices.

loans.use: To increase his stock of soft drinks, candies and detergents.

loans.name: Chan Roth

texts.en:
Chan Roth is 24 years old. She is a mother of two children and resides with her mother and her husband in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up pigs for more than 10 years, earning approximately 3 USD per day. Her husband is excavator driver who earns about 10 USD per day. Her children are still in her care. 

In order to improve her family’s finance, Chan Roth is requesting a loan of 1,300 USD to purchase more farmland to use for growing rice. This money will help her expand her farming business and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run grocery store to earn additional income to support the family.

loans.use: to purchase more farmland to use for growing rice

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a purified drinking water retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of purified water to sell to customers for her purified drinking water business.

Delia has been in this business for six years. Delia earns additional income from her general store.
