Tomás is from Granada.  He’s married and has four children who are all adults and live independently.  He’s a merchant.  He manufactures jewelry.  He started his activity at the age of 20 when he formed his own home and needed to generate income to feed his family.  One of his children helps him in the business and he sells his items throughout Granada.  He also earns additional income from a job he has working in a hotel laundry.  He’d like to expand into the departments to sell at better prices.

He’s requesting the loan to buy raw materials like gold and silver and everything needed to manufacture jewelry.  This loan will help him in that it will allow him to increase merchandise thus improving sales and income.  His next goal is to continue working to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy gold and silver.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married with 3 children. She is 30-years-old and lives in the Philippines. Ruth plants, harvests and sell a variety of vegetables such as squash to earn her living. She has been doing this for 4 years and every month she earns PHP 4,418 from this work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,655 to purchase fertilizer and seedlings to plant. Earlier this year, Ruth become a member of GDMPC. Positively, Ruth hopes to support the studies of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings to plant.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a 45-year-old single woman. She has four children and all are enrolled in school. Zainab sells foodstuffs in a shop. She has worked in this business for four years. Her primary customers are people in the community. Her other source of income includes rental houses. 

She describes her greatest business challenge to be the high prices of commodities and her highest monthly expense is food. She has rented a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Zainab will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more vegetables, cooking oil, wheat flour, and maize flour. She aspires to become a prominent businessperson in the future. She joined Yehu to access loans and to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, cooking oil, wheat flour, and maize flour.

loans.name: Ignace

texts.en: Ignace is 33 years old. He has three children aged between six and nine; all of his children attend school. He sells used shoes and has been in the business for the past 16 years. He wants to use the loan to buy more shoes to sell. With the profits, he plans to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sandrine

texts.en:
Sandrine is 26 years old. She sells kids’ clothes and has been in the business for three years. Her husband works as a businessman. 

She wants the loan to buy more kids’ clothes to sell. With the profits, she will buy a plot of land for cultivation.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Friontina Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer muy luchadora, madre de un pequeño de 6 años al cual saca adelante sola ya que su pareja se separo de ella y desde entonces ha sido madre y padre para su hijo; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, playas hermosas donde uno se puede distraer y maravillarse con la fauna de la localidad; también posee las Islas Ballestas, las cuales son visitadas por infinidad de turistas en todo el año.  Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho salir a pasear con su hijos sobre todo para pasar un tiempo junto a el cómo familia y para distraerse de las preocupaciones del día a día; asimismo le gusta preparar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ají de Gallina”. Estudio solo hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar corte y confección.

Con mucho entusiasmo Sonia trabaja día a día en su negocio de venta de calzado, se dedica alrededor de 10 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 20 clientes de manera diaria, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene productos de moda a precios cómodos y de calidad, por ello sus clientes siempre compran sus productos.

Sonia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias  a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como calzado para invierno; así ella podrá tener mayor variedad de productos y mejorar sus ingresos, así ella podrá seguir adelante y seguir día a día luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Tener un local propio y grande”.
texts.en:
Sonia is a very tenacious woman; she’s the mother of a little six-year-old who she supports by herself since her spouse separated from her and since then she’s been both mother and father to her son. 

Her house is located in the city of Pisco, a city noted for its hot climate all year-round, its beautiful beaches where one can relax and be in awe of the local fauna.  It also has the Ballestas Islands that receive infinity of visitors all year.  

When she has free time available she likes to go out on excursions with her children especially to spend family time together and to relax and forget about daily worries.  She also likes making one of her favorite dishes, the very delicious “Ají de Gallina.” She only studied up to fifth grade of secondary school but would have liked to study dressmaking.

With much enthusiasm Sonia works day to day in her business selling shoes.  She spends about 10 hours daily at work and can see up to 20 customers daily.  She believes that she does well in her business because she has stylish, quality products at affordable prices; this is why her customers always purchase her products.

Sonia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy merchandise like winter shoes to have a wider variety of products and to improve her income and continue to strive daily toward her greatest dream:  to have her own, spacious store.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears next to his taxi in her Kiva profile photo.

Amal is a 43-year-old woman. She is married and a mother of four sons and eight daughters. Eight of her children are married and have their own lives. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past three years, Amal's husband has also been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and a second helper income to the family.

Amal decided to help her husband, so she is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of licensing and insuring his taxi. This will make the taxi legal to move from one area to another and enable Amal's husband to work extra hours and take more internal requests, which will help to improve the family's income positively.

loans.use: to help her husband to license and insure his taxi.

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: Natividad Enma, pertenece a la alcancía comunal La Nueva esperanza conformada por siete integrantes, los cuales son todos vecinos ya que viven en el mismo barrio. Algo que las caracteriza es el esfuerzo que realizan diariamente por salir adelante y dar un mejora económica a sus hogares, muestra de ello es la señora Natividad Enma de 52 años de edad casada y madre de dos hijos que ya son mayores de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa en un pequeño puesto que pudo conseguir por medio de una amiga, hace ya más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica, el cual le ha dado muchas satisfacciones económicas a lo largo de tantos año, una de ella  es la educación de sus hijos y la implementación de mueble para su hogar. En su tiempo libre hace costura diseña y cose pantalones y polos. Con el reciente préstamo lo piensa invertir en la compra de telas .
texts.en:
Natividad Enma belongs to the “La Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) communal bank which has seven members all neighbors living in the same area.  Something that characterizes them is the effort they expend daily in order to get ahead and provide and improve their homes’ economies.  

An example of this is Natividad Enma, 52, married and the mother of two children who are now adults.  She sells clothes in small stand she was able to get through a girlfriend; she’s been engaged in this economic activity for more than 20 years now.  It has given her much economic satisfactions throughout these long years examples of which are her children’s education and the purchase of furniture for her house.  In her free time she enjoys designing and sewing pants and shirts.  She will use the recent loan to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Fanny Ines

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mujeres Progresistas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por las extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Fanny, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, todos ya son mayores de edad y estudian en universidad y  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es jubilado.

Ella para salir adelante junto a su familia y  mucho más ahora que su marido no trabaja, hace tiempo atrás puso una tienda de comestibles en su casa, aprovecho el primer crédito que recibió del banco y así con los siguientes créditos lo fue mejorando, en la actualidad además de su tienda también tiene una copiadora en la cual vende útiles escolares, trabaja todos los días a veces sola y a  veces con la ayuda de su esposo o sus hijos cuando pueden, lleva 11 años con su negocio y espera seguir mejorándolo  con el pasar de los días y con la ayuda de los créditos como lo ha hecho hasta el dia de hoy.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Lleva 11 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener la mejor tienda de su localidad.
texts.en:
The members of the Progresistas community bank meet every 15 days in the canton of Jipijapa, known as the "sultan of coffee" because of its extensive production of peerless coffee. It is also known for its cuisine and for the quality of its people.

Fanny lives in Jipijapa. She is 50 years old, married, and has three grown children who are attending college but still live with her. Fanny's husband is retired.  

To provide for her family, especially now that her husband isn't working, Fanny set up a grocery store in her home. She used her first loan from Fundacion ESPOIR to set up her store, and has used subsequent loans to improve and expand it. Currently, in addition to her grocery store Fanny runs a photocopy service and sells school supplies. She works everyday, often alone, or sometimes with the help of her husband or children when they are available. Her business is 11 years old and she hopes to continue improving it over time with the continued help of the loans that have brought her this far. 
 
This particular loan will be used to stock her store. Fanny will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, and other basic household goods. She has been a member of her community bank for 11 years and enjoys being a part of it because it approved her very first bank loan, which enabled her to start her business. Fanny's goal is to have the best grocery store in her town.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent and other basic groceries.

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cecilia,  está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de verdura fresca, para aumentar el inventario en el negocio, comprara papas, plátanos, yuca, tomates, cebollas, ya que esto le dará más posibilidades de mejorar sus ventas.
Ella considera que con el préstamo anterior mejoro la variedad de verdura al negocio, abriéndole más oportunidades de desarrollo y ganancias.
texts.en: Cecilia is asking for a new loan to buy fresh vegetables to increase her business’ inventory.  She will buy potatoes, bananas, manioc, tomatoes and onions which will give her more possibilities of improving her sales.  She considers that the previous loan improved the variety of vegetables in the business opening more opportunities for development and profits.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Francisca Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora francisca  es originaria de Granada,  soltera,  tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad de vida independiente, inicio su negocio de venta de productos de limpieza con la necesidad de generar ingresos para la manutención de su familia a la edad de 29 años este ha sido su primer negocio donde recibe el apoyo de  su hija menor,  su producto lo comercializa en  el mercado no tiene otros ingresos. Solicito el crédito  para comprar mercadería como bolsas plásticas, papel higiénico y detergente,  cloro, este crédito le permitirá incrementar su negocio mejorando sus ingresos  le gustaría asegurar su tramo seguir trabajando para seguir adelante cliente con deseos de superación.
texts.en:
Francisca is from Granada.  She’s single and has four children who are all adults and live independently.  She started her business selling cleaning supplies needing to generate income to feed her family when she was 29 years old.  This has been her first business and her younger daughter helps her with it.  She sells her wares in the market and has no other source of income. 

She requested the loan to buy merchandise like plastic bags, toilet paper, detergent and chlorine bleach.  This loan will make it possible for her to increase her business improving her income.  She’d like to secure a market space of her own and to continue to work to continue forward with her wish for self-improvement.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a 43 year old woman who is very enterprising and dedicated to her business. She lives in the village of Andabuen province of Isabela.

Margie’s business is a grocery store. She sells many basic staple items there like lard, sugar, beans, rice, oil, margarine, condiments and other products.

Margie needs the loan to buy coffee, sugar, flour, soft-drinks, lime powder, fruit, vegetables, dairy products, noodles, snacks and others. She hopes that with this loan she’ll have more sales.

One of Margie's dreams is that her daughter graduates; Her daughter will graduate as a teacher this year. She also would like to open another similar store to help her daughter improve her life.

loans.use: to purchase coffee, sugar, flour, soft drinks, lime powder and fruit for her business.

loans.name: Ria

texts.en: Ria is married and has three children. Ria is 32 years old and resides in Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Ria cultivates a rice farm to support her family's daily needs. Through this, she gains a monthly income of 4,000 and has been in this business for 5 years . She requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Recently, Ria joined GDMPC. Ria wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en: Vincent is 31 years old. He is married with one four year old child. He sells used shoes. With the loan, he plans to buy ten pairs of new shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more pairs of shoes for sell.

loans.name: Ddamulira

texts.en:
Ddamulira is 50 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has five children. For the past 20 years, Ddamulira has been working hard to manage her poultry, which means she sells chicken. 

To help expand her business, Ddamulira has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase poultry feed, and will help Ddamulira to generate greater profits and increase her capital. Ddamulira hopes that in the future she will be able to earn more money and renovate her rental houses. 

Ddamulira is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ddamulira who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal is a 42 year-old married woman. She has three children and they are all enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Festus and he works as a teacher. Racheal operates a retail shop and sells her goods in a shop. She's worked in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are her community. Racheal's other source of income includes a water selling business. She describes her greatest business challenge to be competition and her highest monthly expenses are food, clothing, and school fees. She has rented a house that has piped water but no electricity. She will use the Kes 20000 loan to buy cooking oil, wheat flour, maize flour. She joined Yehu to access loans and to boost her business's operating capital.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, wheat flour, maize flour.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude is 28 years old. He is married with one child aged three years old. He owns a store of different manufactured products. He has requested a loan to buy more powdered milk and alcoholic beverages. He has been in this business for three years. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more powdered milk and alcoholic beverages for sale.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en: Soledad is a 46 year old woman married to Solomon. She has been engaged in a retail business for two years. She is a very hardworking person and a loving mother. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy rice, oil, coffee, noodles and snack foods for her store. She dreams that someday her business will expand so that she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, coffee, noodles and snack foods for her store.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 50 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children; 2 of them are currently in school. For the past 20 years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand her business and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and increase her capital. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to build a bigger house. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Agnes who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Gloriose

texts.en: Gloriose is 23 years old. She specializes in selling soap and has spent two years in the business. The loan requested will be used to buy more soap to sell. She plans to use the profits to buy a house for her residence.

loans.use: To buy more soap to sell.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia, a 50-year-old married woman, lives in Locsoon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. For over 3 years, she has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

This year, Eugenia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 26-year-old lady from Kisumu and is married to Michael. They have three children aged between one and nine years old.

Elizabeth operates a shoe selling business, which she has done for the last five years, and makes a monthly income of KES 5,000. She is now taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to increase her stock of shoes so that she can meet her clients' demand. Her profits will be used to buy household items.

Her dream is to improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: To increase her stock of shoes.

loans.name: 04.12.5 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Hoa is requesting a loan to purchase instruments to maintain her barber shop. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Hoa is 41 years old and married with 2 children. She lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa City, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. 

In 2011, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid previous 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 04.12.5 Nam Ngạn solidarity group.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes to build a new house, and she hopes for her children to do well in school and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase instruments to maintain her barber shop.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 37 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children; 2 of them are currently in school. For the past 2 years, Samuel has been working hard to manage his internet cafe, which provides computer services. 

To help expand his business, Samuel has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more computers and scanners for use and will help Samuel to generate greater profits and increase his capital. Samuel hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another internet cafe. 

Samuel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Samuel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more computers and scanners for use.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 25 years old. She sells shoes and has been running her business for the past seven years. She has requested a loan to buy more shoes to sell. With the profits from the business, she will increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a 34-year-old, hardworking woman with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has been operating a stationery shop, specifically offering printing services.She has a challenge of price fluctuations, which makes purchasing paper very expensive. Nevertheless, she has a vision of expanding her business to new markets and proving a variety of services. Ruth intends to use the loan to buy a color printer for her shop.

loans.use: to buy a color printer for her shop.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida es una mujer que tiene  25  años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente, además  cuenta con 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijos en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Adelaida vive en casa propia en el caserío  La Colorada del distrito de Morrope del  departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuenta con los servicios de Luz y agua; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 100 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica  Adelaida es la  crianza, compra, engorde  y venta de  animales menores como: aves de corral, ganado caprino, porcinos y ovinos; la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio y también hace labor de pastoreo; sin embargo se menciona que la comercialización la realiza ya sea en el mercado local y/o ha compradores mayoristas de animales, cabe destacar que en esta actividad Adelaida cuenta con 5 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida. Su  cónyuge se dedica  a  la agricultura y también  le apoya en estas actividades.
Actualmente  Adelaida se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a la compra, engorde y venta de animales menores, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 1,000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de  más animales, alimentos balanceados, vitaminas y vacunas; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Adelaida is a woman who is 25 years old, has a partner and she has 3 minor children whom she is responsible for. She lives together with her partner and her children in a house of her own. The standard of living in her community is one of subsistence, most of the people who live there are independent workers in commerce related businesses and raising of small animals, and some of them are also dedicated to agricultural activities. Adelaida lives in a house of her own in La Colorada neighborhood in the Morrope district part of the Lambayeque department. She has light and water services. Around 100 families also live in this neighborhood under the same living conditions.
Adelaida's business activity is the raising, purchase, fattening and sale of small animals such as: poultry, goats, pigs and sheep. The raising of these animals takes place in farmyards that are outside of her house and she also does the tending. However, the selling is done in the local market and/or to wholesalers. It is worth highlighting that Adelaida has 5 years of experience in this activity, which has allowed her to maintain a loyal customer base. Her partner also works in agriculture and also supports her in these activities.
Currently Adelaida is aiming to broaden her inventory in what refers to the purchase, fattening and sale of small animals, this is because it is a very profitable activity in the area. For these reasons she is applying for a new loan worth 1,000 nuevos soles, which will be applied to invest in the purchase of more animals, balanced feed, vitamins and vaccines, which in time will allow her to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase small animals, balanced feed, vitamines and vaccines

loans.name: 04.12.4 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Thủy has a manufacturing business sewing clothes. Thủy has been involved in this business for 6 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase machines to do tailor-made clothing and clothing repair services.

Thủy is 44 years old, and she is married with 2 children. She lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa City, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thủy has successfully repaid 2 previous loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 04.12.4 Nam Ngạn solidarity group. 

The main hardship that Thủy faces in her business is a lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes to build a new house, and she hopes for her business to do well and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase machines for tailoring and clothing repair.

loans.name: Jessica Eunice

texts.es:
Jesica, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio, comprara materiales como panes, salchichas, maíz, leña, aceite y otros productos que son muy necesarios para generar la producción de los alimentos.
Ella considera que con el préstamo anterior pudo mejorar el negocio, que sus ventas han aumentado, para su familia ha tenido mayores ingresos, por esta razón se decide a seguir con este servicio, esperando ser buen cliente.
texts.en:
Jesica has decided to request another loan to buy merchandise such as rolls, sausages, corn, wood, oil, and other supplies necessary to produce the foods she offers at her business.

With the previous loan, she states that she managed to improve the business and increase sales and her family's income. Therefore, she has decided to keep this business running and expects to be a good client.

loans.use: to buy rolls, sausages, corn, wood, and oil.

loans.name: 06.01.09 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Lan has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell.
Lan is 33 years old, and she is married with two children. Lan is the group leader of the 06.01.09 Đông Vệ Solidarity Group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.
In 2010, Lan joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lan has successfully repaid three loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa for Poor Women.
Lan has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital.
With her business profit, Lan hopes her family will be healthy and happy, her business will do well, and her children will do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: 06.01.10 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en: Hương is applying for a loan to purchase clothing to resell. She has a retail business selling clothes, and has been in the business for five years. The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital. Hương is 42 years old and is married with 2 children. She lives in the Dong Ve district and is the leader of a 3-member loan group, the 06.01.10 Đông Vệ solidarity group. In 2010, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hương has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 26 years old. She sells different items in a boutique (general store). With the loan, she will buy sugar, salt, and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used for making savings.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 41 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the Kampala North region of Uganda. For the past 5 years, Betty has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 3000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities for resale, which will help Betty to generate greater profits. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to increase customers and income. 


Betty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Betty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities for resale,

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a thirty-two-year-old married man with personal goals of educating his children and building a permanent house. He used his previous loan to buy phone accessories, and after just four years in business, he has been able to educate his children and expand the business. Lawrence's business challenges are price fluctuations and delayed payments from some customers, however, he has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming and setting up a new outlet. Lawrence needs this loan to buy more phone accessories to sell.

loans.use: to buy phones for resale.

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is 35 years old and is married to a tailor. They have three children and all of them attend school. 

He has been running a boutique (general store) for one and a half years. He wants to add more products in the boutique such as sodas, rice, and sugar to sell. He plans to buy a house with the profits from the business.

loans.use: to buy more items such as sodas, rice, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en: Luvuno is a married woman. She has 4 children and 2 are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Chai. She operates a café and has worked in this business for over 5 years. Her primary customers are the general public. Her other sources of income include farming and rental houses. She describes her greatest business challenges to be credit defaulters and price fluctuations of the commodities, and her highest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Luvuno will use the Kes 40000 to buy maize flour, wheat flour, bags of sugar, maize, and beans. She aspires to expand the business in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, wheat flour, bags of sugar, maize, and beans.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosa, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita más capital para invertir en el negocio, comprándose los materiales necesarios para costura como tela, hilos, ciper, para la fabricación de prendas de vestir para ponerlas a la venta.
Ella manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior logro mejorar el negocio, con las ganancias cubrió sus necesidades en el hogar y el pago de las cuotas, todo se mantenido estable, sin mayores relevancias.
texts.en:
Rosa has decided upon a new loan because she needs more capital to invest in the business.  She will buy the sewing materials that she needs.  She will buy things like fabric, thread, and zippers to make the garments and then sell them.

She says that she managed to improve her business with the previous loan.  With the earnings she covered the household necessities, made her payments, and kept everything stable without any major concerns.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers, and other sewing accessories.

loans.name: Geovanni Aristides

texts.es:
Geovanni, vive en casa propia,  con su abuela, una hermana y dos sobrinos, él tiene 26 años de edad, administra una tienda de productos domésticos, tiene una experiencia de 10 años, pues este negocio lo heredo de su madre.
Él esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos de la tienda, para poderla surtir de boquitas, galletas, azúcar, arroz, aceite, entre otros productos para poder mejorar la atención a los clientes, incrementara el inventario.
Su aspiración es mejorar económicamente,  con este préstamo, para poder tener este apoyo y seguir estudiando en la universidad.
texts.en:
Geovanni lives in his own home with his grandmother, sister, and two nephews. He is 26 years old. For ten years, he has managed a household supplies store that he inherited from his mother.

He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as snacks, cookies, sugar, rice, oil, and other products to stock the store. By expanding his inventory, he can better serve his customers. He also wishes to improve his financial situation with the support of this loan and continue studying at the university.

loans.use: to buy snacks, cookies, sugar, rice, and oil.

loans.name: 02.01.13 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Hiền operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

Hiền is 33 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 02.01.013 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives in Đông Hai commune with 2 dependents. 

In 2011, Hiền joined Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 3 loans from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Ileana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ileana , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo , el cual trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones , doña Ileana desde hace varios años se dedica al comercio de cosméticos , la mayor afectación que se le presenta fue que gran parte del producto lo cedió al crédito y muchos todavía no le terminan de pagar , lo cual ella se encuentra en una situación difícil ya que con las ganancias de los productos apoya para los gastos de hogar . Ella necesita el préstamo para invertir nuevamente y seguir trabajando ya que es el sustento de su familia .
texts.en:
Ileana lives with her husband in the Ticuantepe municipality.  He works in order to help her with the household expenses.  The plan for the future is to improve their living conditions.

Ileana has been selling cosmetics for several years.  The greatest problem she faces is that she sold most of her products on credit, and many customers have still not finished paying her.  That is why she finds herself in a difficult situation. The income from the products goes towards supporting the household expenses.

She needs the loan to invest again and to continue working because it supports her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Joram

texts.en: Joram is a thirty-two-year-old married man with two children, living in Fort Portal Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children. He has been in the transport sector for the last eight years. After starting as a motorcyclist, he later bought a car to work as a taxi. His main hardships are high fuel costs and taxes; however, he has a vision of buying a minibus since the sector is lucrative and predictable. Joram need the loan to buy tires for his car as the ones he has have worn out.

loans.use: to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 35 years old and is married to Jane. They have two children, aged seven and four.
Jackson is an agrovet and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy more veterinary medicines and herbicides to add to his stock for sale.
He hopes to expand his business in the near future and be able to make a lot of profit.

loans.use: to buy more veterinary medicines and herbicides

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 41-year-old butchery owner in Bamburi, Mombasa. She is married, and the mother of six children. Her business has been in operation for the past two years. The business is doing great.

This marks her second business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to renovate her butchery. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and expand her business further. She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to renovate her butchery premises.

loans.name: 04.10 5 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên operates a food stall/restaurant selling noodles. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make the processed food to sell.
Liên is 38 years old, and she is married with two children.
She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 04.10.5 Nam Ngạn Solidarity Group. Liên lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
In 2011, Liên joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her  business. Liên has successfully repaid two loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.
Liên has been involved in this business for two years. The main hardship that Liên faces in her business is the lack of capital.
With her business profit, Liên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make the processed food to sell

loans.name: Ana Elizabet

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de pupusas y tortillas, tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 7 y 10 años de edad, los cuales estudian primaria, Ana se dedica a atender su negocio en el mercado, trabaja de lunes a sábado, tiene 5 años en el negocio, posee bastante clientela.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales, maíz, chicharron, frijoles, quesillo, gas propano y pago del local, este préstamo le ayudara para incrementar sus inventarios y poder mejorar su capacidad de producción de pupusas y tortillas.
Ana quiere fortalecer su negocio y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana devotes herself to taking care of her business at the market.  She works from Monday through Saturday.  She has had the business for five years, and she has plenty of customers.

She is requesting a loan to buy materials, corn, “chicharron” (fried pork rind), beans, fresh cheese, propane gas, and to pay for her site.  This loan will help her increase her inventory, and it will help her to be able to improve her production capacity of pupusas and tortillas.

Ana wants to strengthen her business and offer her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials, corn, “chicharron” (fried pork rind), beans, fresh cheese, propane gas, and to pay for her site.

loans.name: 04.09.6 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Trường operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.
Trường is 60 years old, and she is married with three children.
Trường is the group leader of the 04.09.6 Nam Ngạn Solidarity Group, which consists of four members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent. Her two other children got married.
In 2011, Trường joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her  business. Trường has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Trường has been involved in this business for four years.
The main hardship that Trường faces in her business is the lack of capital.
With her business profit, Trường hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 34 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past year, Mary has been working hard to manage her clinic, which sells medicine. 
To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to improve her business, and it will help Mary to generate greater profits and cater for all the basic needs of her family. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to get the drug shop licenses. 
Mary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to improve her business

loans.name: Emerencia

texts.en:
Emerencia is a 60-year-old woman who is full of perseverance. Her patience, sacrifices and desire to work makes their living conditions better. Her buying and selling business provides for her children's education. Without her business, her children would not be in school or enjoy the advantages of educated persons. 

So at her age, Emerencia still continues to manage her business to further develop their living situation and their small shelter.  She wants to request additional working capital due to insufficient funds in buying bananas to sell. Through this, she wishes to ask a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase bananas and vegetables such as squash and eggplant. Emerencia hopes that her sacrifices in enduring this kind of work will be worth it. She hopes for a higher income this time in order to save for her and her husband, who is getting older.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and vegetables such as squash and eggplant

loans.name: Iradakhan

texts.ru:
Ирадахан 23 года, замужем, имеет годовалого ребенка. Ирадахан с 2009 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес  с 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Ирадахан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется  1 корова с теленком, и 0,7 га земли, где она выращивает картошку и пшеницу.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Ирадахан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку овец и кур. Доходы от кредита Ирадахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней живности.
texts.en: Iradakhan is 23, married, and has a one year-old child. Since 2009 Iradakhan has been involved in animal husbandry, after having started this business with 5,000 somi (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Iradakhan's business now consists of 1 cow with a calf, and .7 hectares of land on which she grows potatoes and wheat. To grow her business, Iradakhan has asked Bai Tushhum & Partners for a loan of 70,000 somi (KGS) to purchase some sheep and chickens. Iradakhan plans to invest the proceeds from the loan into increasing her number of domestic poultry.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a twenty-two-year-old married woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her personal goal has been to build a permanent house and educate her children. She has been farming for the last four years, but over the years she has been able to expand her farming activities. Her hardship is the unpredictable weather changes and her dream is to use modern farming methods so as to increase her yields. Sarah needs the loan to buy maize for planting since the rains have now set in.

loans.use: to buy maize for planting.

loans.name: Kerezgan

texts.ru:
Керезган 45 лет, замужем. Керезган с 1994 года занимается полеводством , начав этот бизнес  с 13,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Керезган, ее хозяйство на сегодняшний день приносит 17,000 сом (KGS)  в месяц.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Керезган обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на семян картофеля нового сорта «Желе».  Доходы от кредита Керезган планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Kerezgan is 45 years old, and married. Since 1994 Kerezgan has been involved in animal husbandry, after starting this business with 13,000 somi (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Kerezgan's business now earns 17,000 somi (KGS) per month. In order to further develop her business, Kerezgan has asked Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 somi (KGS) for buying seeds for the new "Zhele" variety of potatoes. Kerezgan plans to invest the proceeds from the loan into expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Orozgul

texts.ru:
Орозгул 34 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Орозгул 5 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством, стартовав с одной коровы, полученной в качестве подарка на свадьбу. Благодаря упорному труду Орозгул,  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 15 овец и 5 коров, приносящее около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Орозгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота на откорм.  Доходы от кредита Орозгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Orozgul is 34 years old, married, and has 3 children. Five years ago Orozgul got involved in animal husbandry, starting with one cow that she received as a wedding gift. Thanks to her hard work, Orozgul's business now consists of 15 sheep and 5 cows, and earns nearly 10,000 somi (KGS) per month. To further develop her business, Orozgul has asked Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 40,000 somi (KGS) to purchase livestock for fattening and later resale. Orozgul plans to invest the proceeds from the loan into expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is a 34-year-old married man with 3 children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been working with Sub county as an accounts assistant for a period of 10 years. He would like to educate his children, educate himself, and buy land to grow crops. Fred intends to use this loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Katia

texts.es: Katia, tiene la edad 30 de  años, está casada y vive con sus dos hijos y el esposo actualmente. Ella  pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de varios cerdos y además el concentrado para el engorde de los mismos. Ella cuenta con varios cerdos a su poder y lo que pretende es reforzar el negocio y  darle alimentación con concentrado para su engorde más rápido. Ella  quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y de la familia  y crecer con el proyecto de cerdos de engorde. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Katia is 30 years old and married. She currently lives with her husband and their two children. Katia intends to use her loan to buy several pigs and concentrated feed for fattening them. She has several pigs in her possession, but she intends to strengthen her business and provide the pigs with concentrated feed so that the animals can fatten at a quicker rate. Katia wants her pigs to be at the ideal weight so that she can sell them later at the local market and in the surrounding areas. She wants to generate more profits so that she can provide for her family's welfare and grow her pig fattening business.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. Katia has not received any other loans from the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy pigs for fattening and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida, 52, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Aureo, a driver, and is the mother to her two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Zenaida runs an “ukay-ukay” business. “Ukay” literally means to “dig out” or “hollow out” from a stack or heap of anything. In Zenaida’s case, she is selling used (but not yet worn out) clothes that are usually stacked up on a cart. In the Philippines, especially in urban poor communities, many people resort to buying used clothes from “ukay-ukay” stalls. These are very much cheaper compared to brand new clothes sold in malls. Since her cart is located in an urban poor area, her business flourishes. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) net sales every day. 

To help her expand the business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan to buy additional used-but-quality clothes. Customers are attracted to buy from an “ukay-ukay” stall with lots of clothes to choose from. She plans to add more pants or jeans, and also used bags and footwear. If she can roll over the profits from this loan, she can meet the customers’ demand. Through proper management of capital and profit, she can expand her business and boost its income.

Zenaida hopes to to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise needed in her business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 32 years old and lives in the town of Abaita Ababiri in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 4 children, 3 of whom are currently in school. For the past 4 years, Josephine has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells bricks. 

To help expand her business, Josephine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase materials for brick-making, such as firewood, and will help Josephine to generate greater profits and increase her inventory. Josephine hopes that in the future she will be able to own another brick laying business. 

Josephine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Josephine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase brick-making materials such as firewood.

loans.name: 3.13. 151.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en: Minh is 44 years old. She is married, has four grown children, and is the group leader of the "3.13. 151.Thiệu Khánh" solidarity group, which consists of 10 members. Minh lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She operates a combined food stall and restaurant selling fish, and has done so for five years. The main hardship Minh faces in her business is the lack of capital, so she is requesting a loan to purchase a fishing net to catch fish. This is Minh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her business profit, Minh hopes for her business to do well, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net to catch fish.

loans.name: Jose Rudys

texts.es:
José, tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su esposa y un hijo de un año de edad, tienen casa propia, él se dedica a la agricultura, trabaja en lo propio, aprendió desde muy joven con su padre.
El esta iniciando la siembra, solicita un préstamo para la compra de semilla para la siembra de maíz, también comprara 1000 plantas de chile, abono y herbicidas,  con esto obtendrá el dinero para invertir en el cultivo de chile y maíz.
La aspiración de José es que a través del préstamo pueda mejorar sus cosechas y que le permita mejorar sus ingresos económicos para sacar a su familia adelante, mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José, age 36, lives in his own home with his wife and their one-year-old son. He is a farmer and works on his own land. José learned this trade at a very young age from his father.

He is starting the planting season, so he is requesting a loan to buy seeds for planting corn, as well as 1,000 chili pepper plants, compost, and herbicides. By obtaining this money, he can invest in his chili pepper and corn crops.

José aspires to improve his crops with this loan, thus allowing him to improve his finances so that his family can move forward and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy improved seeds for planting corn, 1000 chili pepper plants, compost, and herbicides.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha is a 59-year old married woman. She has been selling fish at the market for the last 10 years. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her spouse's earnings add additional income to the household. Mwanasha says that her biggest business challenge is competition in the market. She aspires to open a kiosk in future and joined Yehu to get access to affordable loans. With this 15,000 KES loan, Mwanasha intends to purchase fish and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: 06.11.07 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en: Thanh is 44 years old and is married with 4 children. Two of her children she supports at home in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. The other two have grown up and married. Thanh has a retail business selling dry food, which she has done for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thanh faces in her business is the lack of capital. In 2011, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thanh is the leader of a 6-member group, the "06.11.07 Đông Vệ" solidarity group.  She is requesting a loan to purchase household commodities to resell. With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase household commodities to resell.

loans.name: Melina

texts.en:
This is Melina, 55, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Federico, a vendor. She if the mother of four children. She and her husband manage their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continue to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Melina operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from the round palm-sized ones, to the much larger doormats, braided quilts, and bed sheets, as well as other crafts that most rug-makers make every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. 

Melina earns additional income from their tricycle which her husband drives regularly. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000. She will be using the loan to buy more raw materials like fabric, and thread for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Melina dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high-quality education through her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Zephanus

texts.en: Zephanus is a 27-seven-year old hardworking man with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a teacher and is very passionate about his job, since it has always been his childhood dream. His personal goals are educating his children, building a permanent house and upgrading his studies as he hopes to someday become a principal. Zephanus needs the loan to buy land so as to set up a family house.

loans.use: to buy land on which to set up a family house.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
At the age of 19, Jonalyn got married. She is lucky to be married to a farmer and blessed with three children. Now, Jonalyn is in 39 years old. Her children are in high school and elementary school. Jonalyn's priority in life is to prepare her children for the college level of education and she wants to see that her children will become professionals someday.

Jonalyn runs a rice farming business with an area of five hectares. She and her husband manage the farm. She has been in this business since she got married. Jonalyn and her husband are doing some field activities to minimize their labor expense. Since they don’t have enough capital to hire laborers, Jonalyn is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy hybrid rice seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and pay the labor costs in rice farming.

loans.use: to buy hybrid rice seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and pay the labor costs in rice farming.

loans.name: Selevano

texts.en: Selevano is a 30-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children. He has been in the motorcycle transit business for three years. He bought the motorcycle with the money he saved from his wages as a casual laborer. He has challenges of high fuel costs and mechanical breakdowns. His dream is to diversify and start farming. Selevano needs the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is 26 years old, married, and has one child. He is married to a bookkeeper, who is his partner in supporting their family. Virgilio has managed a rice farming business for four years. Virgilio earns an income of approximately PHP 50,000 per crop from his three hectares of rice fields. Due to an unexpected typhoon that destroyed his crops and caused low yields, Virgilio earned just PHP 25,000 for his last crop.

Virgilio’s earnings for his last crop went toward their household expenses. The amount left will be used to pay the cost of farm labor. Virgilio is currently facing a financial shortage for maintaining his business. Virgilio is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy rice seeds to grow, fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides for plant care. He knows the loan will be a big help to him to maintain his farming business.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds to grow, fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides for plant care.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en: Nina is a 23-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband. They cooperate together in order to better develop their way of living. Nina has owned a beauty salon since 2010. She is very good at her job, especially after many years of experience. In order to improve her business, she is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l, to purchase new beauty products and to renew her old ones. In the future, Nina plans to enlarge her shop and hire people to work with her.

loans.use: to purchase new beauty products and to renew her old ones

loans.name: Viktoriya

texts.ru:
Виктории 31 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Виктория 5 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством, стартовав с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Виктории,  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 дойные коровы, продажа молока приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Виктория обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойных коров.  Доходы от кредита Виктория планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Viktoriya is 31 years old, married, and has two children. She started raising livestock 5 years ago, starting with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to tireless work she today owns two dairy cows, whose milk earns her approximately 15,000 som (KGS) a month. 

Aiming at further development of her business, Viktoriya came to Bai Tushum and Partners for a 100,000 som (KGS) loan to buy dairy cows. She plans to invest profit from the loan into further increasing her holdings.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Saa'di

texts.en:
Saa'di is a conservative person who prefers not to have his photo published online, so his brother appears in his Kiva profile photo, along with the refrigerator Saa'di wants to purchase.

Saa'di is a 33-year-old married man, with one son and two daughters. Saa'di is employed and earns a small salary, which is not enough to cover all of the family's needs and costs. Saa'di wants to improve his family's living conditions by replacing their old refrigerator with a new one. This is especially important since summer is around the corner and the family want to get a suitable refrigerator to preserve food properly and to drink cool water. Saa'di is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing the refrigerator.

loans.use: To purchase a new refrigerator

loans.name: Nawale

texts.en: Nawale is a 27-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. Her husband is responsible for covering his family's living expenses. He’s a barber with thirteen years of experience. Nawale is a very passionate teacher. She gives private lessons on a free-lance basis. She is asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l, to buy a car in order to visit her students on time without being late. In the future, she plans to have her own teaching place.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Procesa

texts.en:
This is Procesa, 49, resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Jesus, her business partner. Procesa is a mother to her four children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to provide continuous income for her everyday expenses.  

Procesa operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers lace, curtains, and other home items. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are met all year round. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 in sales every day

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread, and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Procesa hopes her business grows and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all of her hard work with her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Bububatma

texts.ru:
Бубубатме 51 года, замужем, имеет 7 детей. Бубубатма с 1985 года занимается животноводством, стартовав с суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Бубубатмы,  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 дойная корова, 1 бычок, 2 овцы, 6 коз. Продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 5,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бубубатма обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Бубубатма планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Bububatma is 51 years old, married, and has seven children. She has been raising livestock since 1985, when she started with 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her tireless work Bububatma now owns one milk cow, one bull calf, two sheep, and six goats. Sale of milk and dairy products bring in around 5,000 som per month. In order to further develop her business Bububatma came to Bai Tushum and Partners for a 100,000 som (KGS) loan to buy more livestock. She plans to invest income earned from the loan into future development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is 49 years old and lives in the town of Abaita Ababiri in the Kampala north region of Uganda. She is married and has five children; one of them is currently in school. For the past 5 years, Georgina  has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Georgina  has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities like salt for resale, and will help Georgina to generate and increase profits. Georgina  hopes that in the future she will be able to purchase more items for better sales. 

Georgina  is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Georgina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities like salt for resale

loans.name: Komba Sandi's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from one of the primary schools in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of 5,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to invest in items that are beyond their salaries' limits. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan from their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making the repayment on their behalf.

The leader of this team is Komba, 50 years old, pictured in the middle of the photo. He is a native of Kayima, in eastern Sierra Leone, and is married to a housewife. Komba has four children – two in primary school, one in college and the other still too young for school. Komba has been a professional teacher for 20 years. He has requested this loan in order to to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak is a 22-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and two working siblings. She has three years of experience in teaching. Since Malak wishes to take some responsibilities off of her father, she works hard and looks forward to improving in this domain.

Malak decided to take a youth loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l, in order to purchase a board and equip her studying room. She expects to provide her students with high quality teaching, and that’s what will improve her work the most. In the future, she plans to join a local school and better improve her skills.

loans.use: to purchase a board and equip her studying room

loans.name: Guljan

texts.ru: Гулжан 42 года,  воспитывает 4 детей.   В 2004 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Гулжан начала свой бизнес в торговле продуктами питания со стартовой суммой в 8,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Гулжан сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Гулжан  обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 62,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от кредита Гулжан  планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса и часть – откладывать на образование детей в ВУЗе.
texts.en: Guljan is 42 years old and is raising four children. In 2004 she was in search of a source of income for her family when she began her own business in grocery sales with an initial 8,000 som (KGS) in capital. Thanks to her persistence and hard work Guljan was able to develop her business to the point where it is bringing in a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS). Her current range of goods is somewhat limited so Guljan came to Bai Tushum and Partners for a 62,000 som (KGS) loan. She plans to invest the income earned as a result of the loan into development of the business, and also partly into savings for her children's college educations.

loans.use: expand her range of goods

loans.name: Sahr Edward's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are primary school teachers from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of 5,300,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they repay SMT/Kiva, using their monthly salaries. 

Pictured at the right is Sahr, 42 years old, the leader of the group. He is a native of Kawama, in eastern Sierra Leone. Sahr is married to a trader and the couple has six children – two in primary school, three in secondary school and one still too young for school. Sahr has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials – iron corrugated zinc, cement, etc. - for the construction of a family dwelling.

loans.use: to buy house building materials

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng is 44 years old and a permanent resident of Prey Chhor district, located in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She generates her income from crop husbandry, planting crops such as rice, vegetables and potatoes on farmland she owns. She has been involved in this business for ages. Heng has her husband, who is supportive, help manage all the maintenance at the field. She uses her income to meet her daily needs and care for her children.

To improve her farming business, Heng would like a loan to invest in planting potato crops this coming season. This loan will enable her to make developments in her business and she hopes to generate a good income from this investment.

loans.use: to invest in planting potato crops this coming season.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en: Jihad is a 37-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and one school-aged child. Jihad takes care of his family and offers them a good way of living. He started his own business in 1997, selling spare parts for used cars.  Today, he needs to take a loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l, to purchase more spare parts for his business. He notes that this will enhance his sales, thus his income.  In the future, Jihad plans to expand his business in order to earn a better income.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts for his business

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 23-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and two siblings. Hussein’s father is the main income provider for the family. Hussein had many years of experience as a carpenter before he decided to open his own carpentry.  He works with high professionalism and has gained a fair number of customers so far. Today, he’s looking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l, to purchase a new electrical saw for his business. This will improve his work and allow him to present a good quality job for his customers. In the future, Hussein plans to take on bigger projects and augment his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase a new electrical saw

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en: Sauda is taking out another loan of KES 60,000 to expand her existing business. She plans to use the loan to open a cafe and purchase wheat flour, rice, and sugar. Since Sauda's previous loan, her business has grown, her monthly income has increased and her living standards have improved.

loans.use: to open a cafe and to purchase wheat flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en: Tarek is a 39-year-old married man living with his wife and four children. He is in charge of satisfying his family's needs and demands. Tarek had 8 years of experience as a car blacksmith before he decided to open his own garage many years ago. Today, Tarek is seeking a loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l, to purchase needed products, such as paint and many other items, for his business. He notes that this will develop his business and thus increase his revenues. In the future, Tarek plans to enlarge his garage in order to serve more customers.

loans.use: to purchase needed products for his business

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru:
Мунире 40 лет, замужем, воспитала 4 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Мунира с 1997 года занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний  день в хозяйстве Муниры имеется 2 коровы, 2 лошади, 2 бычка и 1,6 га орошаемой земли, где она выращивает фасоль и картофель. Продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса за счет покупки скота, Мунира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от кредита Мунира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Munira is 40 years old, has four children, and is married. As her family's sole income earner she has been farming and raising livestock since 1997. She started the business with 15,000 som (KGS). Today Munira owns two cows, two horses, two bull calves, and 1.6 hectares of cultivated land where she grows beans and potatoes. Sale of milk and dairy products brings in around 5,000 som (KGS) per month. 

In order to further develop her business Munira came to Bai Tushum and Partners for a 100,000 som (KGS) loan for the purchase of livestock. She plans to invest income from the loan into future expansion of her holdings.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Koku

texts.fr: Homme de 45ans, Mr Koku est marié à une commerçante et 03 enfants tous à l’école. Le premier a 20ans et le dernier 17ans. Il est revendeur de matériaux de construction depuis 2005. Il est aidé par 01 personne et l’exerce dans une boutique. Ses achats se font à Lomé. Sa difficulté principale est la concurrence sur le terrain. Il sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter des matériaux de construction afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients.  Il veut agrandir son activité et avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
A 45-year-old man, Mr. Koku is married to a merchant and has three children, who are all in school. The first child is 20 years old, and the last is 17. He has been a retailer of construction materials since 2005. He is helped by one person and operates in his store. His purchases are made in Lomé. His main difficulty is the competition on the ground. 

Mr. Koku is requesting this initial loan from WAGES to buy some construction materials in order to respond further to customers needs. He wants to expand his business and to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando, tiene la edad  de 41 años, está casada,  vive con sus dos hijos y la esposa actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar insumos como abono, plaguicidas, herbicidas, foliares. El tiene pensado comprar todos estos insumos para brindarle un excelente mantenimiento al café y asi poder obtener una excelente producción de la plantación de café y  así poder  obtener más ganancias  para obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Orlando is 41 years old, married, and currently lives with his wife and two children. He plans to use the loan to purchase supplies like fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides, and foliar sprays. He is planning to purchase these supplies to help him to cultivate his coffee crop and to help him obtain excellent production from his field so that he can earn more income, have a better quality of life, and financial stability. The is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has never had any other loans through state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him this loan with better conditions and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies.

loans.name: Mohammed
